This one is the early style Marlin Carbine with the factory Brass Saddle Ring, chambered in brush-busting .44 Magnum. These were only produced for a short while from 1969-71.

title: For Sale:  Glock, M-26, 9mm Semi Auto
postcontent:
$424.75 + 6% tax

Condition: Used but lightly fired. 

The Gen4 Glock 26 is a square chunk of a gun, and is at (or just past) the outer limits of what I consider concealable in a pocket. Loaded it weighs over 26 ounces, and it’s 6.3 inches long. Perhaps just as importantly, it is as wide as its big brother the G17 (1.18 inches), making it rather big-boned for a pocket gun. That said, 10+1 rounds of 9mm in a pistol small enough to hide almost anywhere is one heck of a combination—and the reason the Baby Glocks are so popular. Well, one of the reasons.
Another reason Glocks are so popular is that they are disgustingly, relentlessly, boringly reliable. Pull the trigger, it goes bang. Period.

The M6A2™ rifle’s edge in capability, reliability, accuracy and long service life is the result of advanced technology materials and manufacturing processes, combined with progressive patented designs. All LWRCI™ carbine systems feature our short-stroke gas-piston operating system. The operating system is lightweight, self-regulating, and self-scraping. This system of operation does not foul the moving parts of the weapon with carbon or heat, greatly enhancing service life and reliability while decreasing both user and armorer maintenance. All M6A2™ rifles feature a match grade, cold rotary hammer forged barrel with a target crown. The barrel is treated with NiCorr™ surface conversion technology that extends service life, enhances accuracy, and increases the effective range of the weapon. As in all of our rifles, the bolt carrier group and the barrel extension of the M6A2™ rifle is coated with EXO’s patented nickel-boron surface conversion technology that provides a hard permanent lubrication to the moving parts.

The M6A2™ rifle defines itself as the most modern and incrementally evolved carbine in the world. At the same time it also presents the best value. Service life is extended to four times that of a legacy M4, accuracy is 100 percent better, and our M6 rifles are many times more reliable than the legacy gas-impingement design. 

comes with box, original paperwork, lwrc oil, foward grip, $1,700 or best offer please call REDACTED

title: For Sale/Trade:  Very Rare Romanian SKS in Incredible cond. Yugo also up for grabs.
postcontent:
2 of my first rifles are up on the block.  I am the only owner of both of these girls since they were imported. 

First up the Romanian MDL 1956, besides the first trip to the range and 40 rounds she only comes out to be cleaned, admired and then gently back to safety.  The rifle is all matching, everything.  It is all original, I have never refinished or touched up anything, ever.  The rifle is in immaculate condition and the wood is just lovely.  Whoever fielded this in Romanian took great lengths to keep it in this shape.  Bayonet,mag and all hardware is there and in great shape. title: For Sale/Trade:  LNIB: WALTHER PPS 9MM 2 MAGS
postcontent:
LNIB: WALTHER PPS 9MM 2 MAGS CASE AND ALL MANUALS $550 OBO EMAIL OR CALL TXT REDACTED MUST SHOW VALID DL AND CARRY PERMIT TO BUY OR TRADE.


Walther PPS is short recoil operated, locked breech pistol that uses modified Browning type locking with tilting barrel. Frame of the gun is made from impact resistant polymer. Trigger is of double action only type, striker fired, with pre-cocked striker system, similar to QA system used in Walther P99 pistols. This system requires a manual recocking (by partial slide retraction) in the case of misfire. Gun is fitted with automated trigger safety and firing pin block; additional "storage type" safety is provided by removable backstrap of the grip; once backstrap is removed, the firing pin is automatically decocked and gun is blocked until the backstrap is reinstalled. This patented system is called QuickSafe by Walther. Sights are low profile, with rear sight adjustable for windage.

title: For Sale:  Springfield "Loaded" 1911-A1 w Novak 14-kt Gold Sight
postcontent:
Springfield Loaded 1911-A1 .45 ACP
    Product Code PX9608  ( this product code is no longer listed in the current Springfield Armory catalog )
    comes with original factory hard case
    2 magazines (marked "SA 45 NM" on the floor plate)
    Novak rear sight, plain black  (from the factory)
    Novak 14-kt gold bead front sight installed by Novak's in October 2010

        + $5.65 Novak's, ship slide to ( October 02, 2010 )
        + $99.95  Novak's 14-kt Gold Bead Front Sight  ( part ) ( currently $119.95 )
        + $35.00 Novak's, mill front slide ( labor ) (current production "Loaded" 1911s have the dovetail cut from the factory)
        + $20.00 Novak's, install front sight ( labor )
        + $16.00 Novak's, return shipping from 
        = $ 176.60




    skateboard grip-tape on front-strap
    This is a trick I learned from some SWAT guys in a gun shop, as an inexpensive method to get a better gripping surface.  The tape has been on for 3 - 4 years.  Since this has been sitting in the safe, the tape hasn't been worn.  The SWAT guys who actually do this told me that on their guns, they had to replace the grip tape 2 - 3 times a year.   Since it's so inexpensive, cost was not really an issue.  Just make sure to clean the surface thoroughly before replacing the grip tape.

    blue finish  
    The finish on the frame is original from the factory.
    The finish on the slide was re-done by Novak's in 2010, after they cut the dovetail and installed the front sight.


I am the original owner, and purchased this new in October 1999.




It has between 500 - 1,000 rounds through it, but I haven't shot this much (if at all) since around 2002 or 2003. All of the ammo was full-metal-jacket (FMJ), some of Wolf (old style, with the laquer coating). No problems were encountered (at least none that I can recall).

There is holster wear on the edges, the "idiot mark" below the slide release lever, and a scratch on the right-side of the slide below the rear-sight. While never my every-day carry (EDC) gun, I did carry this for protection on camping trips.

(waring: profanity in video) : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lEABZswQWDg


The only modification I would suggest would be to replace the full-length guid rod (FLGR) with a standard guide rod and plug. FLGRs were popular in the 1990s, but don't really add any functional value to a 1911, and make it a bit more difficult to take apart.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GFaS-2SM6WU



If I have time, I'll take some better pictures.
I know I always keep saying that one of these days I'll get a proper setup with studio lighting,
rather than depending on either the crappy lighting inside my house or certain times of day when natural sunlight is favorable.
Or maybe I should just learn to use Photo Shop.
Dust sticking to the oil on the pistol shows up really well in most of these pictures below.

title: For Sale:  Smith & Wesson 586-4 6" .357 Magnum
postcontent:
Smith & Wesson 586-4 
.357 Magnum Revolver
$750



Smith & Wesson 586-4
Product Code 103536
blue finish
6 inch barrel
original box included

I bought this used in 2004, and never shot it. After purchasing this, I obtained a Smith & Wesson 686 with a 4 inch barrel for when I do feel like shooting .357.

According to the Standard Catalog of Smith & Wesson, (p. 249), the 586-4 was introduced in 1993, and replaced with the 586-6 in 1997. This is a "pre-lock" gun.

586, 1981 Intro
586-1, 1986 Radius stud package, floating hand.
586-2, 1987 Change hammer nose and associated parts.
586-M, 1987 Product warning by S&W, M overstamp to indicate factory (mod for 586 and 586-1)
586-3, 1988 New yoke retention system. 1992 Delete 8 3/8" barrel and four-position front site. 1992 Delete nickel finish
586-4 1994 Drill and tap, synthetic grips, change rear site and extractor. 1995 Delete square butt. 1997 Delete 8 3/8" barrel, change to MIM thumb piece.
586-5, 1998 Change design to eliminate cylider stop stud. Change to MIM hammer with floating firing pin, change to MIM trigger, change internal lockworks.


Production of the 586, along with most other blue revolvers by Smith & Wesson, ended around 10 years ago. The Model 686 is the same gun, except made from stainless steel.

NOTE: Smith & Wesson has recently re-introduced the 586, with the lock, as part of their "Classics" line of revolvers.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yQ4b27su76M






Like any .357 Magnum revolver, the 586 can also shoot .38 Specials.

A note about the pictures below. When photographing guns, the pictures tend to make the gun either look worse than it really is, or better than it really is, depending on the light; especially off a reflective blue surface, or if the gun is oiled,etc. Specks of dust and fingerprints tend to show up especially well when photographing guns. In some of the photos below, the reflections make it look like the blue finish is worn. I can assure you that it is not, and except for the wear on the front of the cylinder (presumably from being fired by the previous owner), and the turn marks on the cylinder, the finish on this revolver is 95% - 99%. The trigger and hammer appear to be a "case hardened" finish. Some of the photographs make it look "glossier" than it really is.

Details about the ammo Manufacturer:
Military Ballistics Industries (MBI) specializes in custom ammunition and ordinance products for use by the military, law enforcement agencies, and training facilities in the United States.

This remanufactured (reloaded in a factory) product is brass-cased, boxer-primed, non-corrosive, reloadable, and packaged in 100 round, sealed plastic-packs. It is both economical and precision manufactured by an established American cartridge producer. 

Remanufactured ammunition has been around for decades. Some of the world’s best shooters use only remanufactured or custom manufactured ammunition to achieve a level of consistency and optimal ballistics performance that cannot be achieved with mass-manufactured ammunition. Remanufactured ammunition is produced by assembling carefully selected components to include specialty bullets, propellants, primers, and previously spent brass cartridge casings. The bullets, propellant, and primers are always newly manufactured while the brass cartridge casings are typically reprocessed to reduce costs or improve consistency. 

This MBI product is manufactured using only the highest quality products available to ensure consistent ballistics and firing performance. The propellant is manufactured by Hodgdon, the bullets are manufactured at either the Lake City military manufacturing facilities or by Hornady, and the primers are manufactured by either CCI or Winchester. In addition to using only the best available components, MBI ammunition is assembled using some of the most modern electronic press equipment available. Because exceptional consistency is a major factor in creating accurate ammunition, a production facility that uses finely calibrated electronic press technology is key to ensuring that each shooter is well-pleased with the performance of their ammunition. 

Each brass cartridge casing used to produce MBI ammunition is processed by first undergoing a lengthy mechanical cleansing process. Once cleaned, each casing is then re-calibrated by an electronic press to ensure that the final dimensions of each round are within micrometer tolerances. Each casing is then re-primed and re-charged using high-quality primer and propellants. Once the new bullet is seated using a precision-tuned electronic press, each round is hand-inspected to ensure perfection. 

This product is not just remanufactured ammunition. It is “precision” remanufactured ammunition for the serious shooter. The fact that it costs less than most new ammunition is simply an added benefit

title: For Sale/Trade:  WTT Vehicle Remote Start Install for handguns. See desc.
postcontent:
Tired of this agonizing heat? Want a remote start/keyless entry system installed in your car but don't want to dish out the $400 to have it done? I'm giving the opportunity to local business owners and individuals to trade away a pistol for this product and service. If the trade doesn't match up perfect then cash can be added to either end.

Here's what I'm offering:
Viper 4103 Remote Start System w/ keyless entry
 -Remote engine start
 -Keyless lock/unlock
 -Factory alarm arm/disarm (if equipped and compatible)
 -Panic & horn confirmation
 -Parking light confirmation
 -Trunk release (if electric push button style)
I will also provide:
 -Transponder interface module (90% of cars need this, even without a chip in the key)
 -Relays, diodes, resistors, etc.
My service:
 -Take comfort in knowing that this will be installed by a professional that has been in the business for 13 years. I'm MECP Advanced certified and have a high standard for my installs. My connections are soldered, loomed underhood, and clean wire management. I don't take shortcuts even when you can't see the work done.

The cost for this to be done at a local shop starts at $220, averages $380, and can sometimes go up to the $600 range. Half of the features I listed are not included in the basic install at the shop either and will certainly have added charges.

I'm not trying to discount my service, I'm offering what you want with a handgun as payment. That's all, simple! If needed, I will fill out and pass a CBI as well.

THE BEST PART:
I will come to you to do the install. If you're too busy to come to me than I will come to you. If you want to drop your car off at my house I will do it here. Don't be afraid to make an offer just because your in the springs, I'll go there too (just remember that when valuing the trade)

Although a remote start is being offered, I can install whatever it is you want for your vehicle. Some others are: In-dash monitors & decks, speakers, amplifiers, subwoofers, overhead monitors, headrest monitors, backup cameras, iPod interfaces, alarms, keyless entry systems. Whatever you want done I'm sure I can make it happen.

If you're interested then reply with:
 - your name and email
 - what service you want
 - year/make/model and trim level of your vehicle
 - what you have to trade

I will respond with what the value of the items and service is so we can try to match up a fair trade.

title: For Sale:  Mak-90 /Type 56 "assault" rifle/ AK-47
location: Speedway and Swan., Arizona, United States
postcontent:
This is a MAK-90 style AK   In 7.62X39mm
Also known as a type 56 assault rifle made and imported by Norinco.
This is in beautiful condition, only a few very fine scratches in the stock.
No rust spots anywhere, has been in the safe all this time.
All matching serial numbers.
These were imported into America between 1990-1994.
The stock was made as a thumb hole style to "sporterize" it.  The grip feels great/ very comfortable in the hand.
I believe the barrel is 16 1/4 inches long.
The rifling is very sharp and clean, from a low round count.
Inherited this from my Uncle a few months ago. Took it apart to check it out before shooting, and it still had much of the grease that it was imported with in the trigger group. I put about 60 rounds through it to dial in the sights, and with the amount left from the only bulk box of ammo that he bought for it, I would say that it has had less than 200 round through it. Not even broken in.  No jams or any other problems.

This comes with everything pictured. 
Plus  a 5 round magazine( not shown.)
and      160 rounds of ammo(not shown)
The extra stock is from another Mak-90, it has some dents and dings in it, but I would cut the grip into a regular handle, slant it back to the butt, to make a cool custom stock, but that's up to you.

The muzzle brake was also from another MAK-90, does not fit, but with a little filing with make a good tight fit.

I would love to keep this and make it a good "cool" project, but I already have one AK and don't need another right now.

Warning: I will absolutely require a bill of sale saying that you are not a felon and are allowed to buy and own firearms. I will need your name and drivers licence number. Better if you have a CCW, but not needed.
If this turns you away from the deal, GOOD. 
 I will answer emails back as fast as I can. Want to have a good fair/ trust able sale, not in a super hurry to get rid of it.   If this is what you are wanting, make me a deal. Lowball offers will be laughed at, and not responded to.   This will go to the best trust able offer.
